front.titlePage:
The Effects of Collisions with Neutral Particles on the InstabiUty of Two
Superposed Composite Plasmas Streaming Through Porous Medium
Mohamed Fahmy El-Sayed
Department of Mathematics and Computer Science, Faculty of Science,
United Arab Emirates University, R O. Box 17551 Al Ain, U. A. E.
Also at: Department of Madiematics, Faculty of Education,
Ain Shams University, Roxy, Cairo, Egypt
Reprint requests to Dr. M, R El-Sayed; E-mail; elsayed@nyx.uaeu.ac.ae
Z. Naturforsch. 54 a, 411^16 (1999); received April 19, 1999
front.div:
The effects of collisions widi neutral atoms on die hydromagnetic stability of the plane interface
separating two streaming superposed composite plasmas of uniform densities in a porous medium
are investigated. In die absence of fluid velocities, it is found, for a potentially stable configuration,
that die system remains stable, while for a potentially unstable configuraion, the unstable system
becomes stable under a certain condition of die wavenumber depending on the values of thc fluid
densities, Alfven velocities, and die orientation of die magnetic field. The porosity of die porous
medium does not have any significant effect on die stability criterion. In the presence of fluid
velocities, it is found that, the instability criterion is independent of the permeability of die medium
and die collision effects widi neutral particles. The criterion determing die stability does not depend
on the permeability of the medium but depends on die density of neutral particles. The porosity of
the medium is found to have a significant effect on bodi the stability and instability criteria in this
case. The role of die permeability of the medium, die collisional frequency, and the porosity of die
porous medium on the growth rate of the unstable mode is examined analitically. Routh's test of
stability is applied to confirm the above results.
front.keywords:
Key words: HydTodynzmic Stability; Flows dirough Porous Media; Magnetohydrodynamics;
Plasma flow; Instabilities in Plasma.
